intro: Hieracium staurodes, commonly known as the star-daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its bright yellow flowers, which resemble daisies, bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
